decks.notes: This deck focuses on aggressively building up devotion to black through efficient creatures and powerful removal spells. The key strategy is to control the board with removal spells like Thoughtseize, Hero's Downfall, and Bile Blight while creating a strong board presence with creatures like Pack Rat, Nightveil Specter, Gray Merchant of Asphodel, and Desecration Demon. The use of Mutavault and Whip of Erebos adds versatility and resilience to the deck. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and drain their life with Gray Merchant of Asphodel.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures while controlling the board with counterspells and tempo plays. By utilizing cards like Thassa, God of the Sea and Master of Waves, the deck aims to generate value and create a wide board presence. The inclusion of Mutavault provides additional creature synergy and flexibility. The deck's strategy revolves around establishing early pressure and maintaining board control to secure a victory before the opponent can stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, aggressive creatures and disruption spells. By utilizing cards like Thassa, God of the Sea and Master of Waves, the deck aims to quickly build a board presence and apply pressure to the opponent. Tempo plays, such as using Detention Sphere and Tidebinder Mage to control the opponent's board, are also key to maintaining the advantage and ensuring victory. Overall, the deck is built around the strategy of quickly establishing dominance on the battlefield and outpacing the opponent.

The deck focuses on a fast-paced, aggressive playstyle by utilizing a combination of creatures like Stormbreath Dragon, Polukranos, and Reaper of the Wilds to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It also includes removal spells such as Mizzium Mortars and Dreadbore to deal with any threats the opponent may have. The deck aims to control the battlefield with cards like Sylvan Caryatid and Courser of Kruphix while also generating additional resources with cards like Xenagos, the Reveler and Domri Rade. The deck aims to apply constant pressure and keep the opponent on the back foot throughout the game.

The main concept of this Jund Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and removal spells. The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with cards like Sylvan Caryatid and Elvish Mystic to bring out powerful threats like Stormbreath Dragon and Polukranos, World Eater. Domri Rade and Xenagos, the Reveler provide additional mana and card advantage, while cards like Dreadbore and Ghor-Clan Rampager help deal with opposing threats. The deck aims to maintain control of the board while pressuring the opponent with a variety of powerful creatures.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive black creatures while also gaining devotion to black to make use of powerful black-centric cards like Gray Merchant of Asphodel and Erebos, God of the Dead. With a focus on disruption through cards like Thoughtseize and removal spells like Hero's Downfall, the deck aims to control the board and drain the opponent's life total to secure a victory. The inclusion of cards like Desecration Demon and Pack Rat provide additional threats and ways to apply pressure to the opponent.

The deck focuses on using aggressive creatures with black mana symbols in their casting cost to efficiently deal damage to the opponent while also gaining value through card advantage and life gain. It aims to control the board using removal spells like Hero's Downfall and Devour Flesh, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with Thoughtseize. The key strategy is to build up a strong board presence with creatures like Pack Rat and Gray Merchant of Asphodel, while also using the powerful threat of Desecration Demon to apply pressure and close out games quickly.

The deck focuses on controlling the board with counterspells, removal spells, and board wipes, while generating card advantage through card draw effects like Sphinx's Revelation. It also aims to stabilize the board with planeswalkers like Jace, Architect of Thought and Elspeth, Sun's Champion. The deck includes mana fixing and ramp in the form of Sylvan Caryatid and various lands to ensure consistency in casting powerful spells. A win condition can be achieved through Aetherling's ability to become unblockable and deal damage, as well as through accumulating card advantage and overwhelming the opponent with powerful threats.

The main idea behind this deck is to control the game by using a variety of spells to counter, remove, and control threats from the opponent. The deck focuses on using powerful control cards like Detention Sphere, Supreme Verdict, and Sphinx's Revelation to maintain board control and generate card advantage. By combining counterspells like Counterflux and Dissolve with removal spells like Azorius Charm and Mizzium Mortars, the deck aims to stall the game until it can unleash powerful finishers like Aetherling, Elspeth, Sun's Champion, and Jace, Architect of Thought to secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and planeswalkers. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Detention Sphere and Thoughtseize, while also generating card advantage and stabilizing the board with cards like Sphinx's Revelation and Supreme Verdict. The win condition of the deck is to eventually overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats like Aetherling and Elspeth, Sun's Champion, while using Jace, Architect of Thought to generate incremental advantage and card selection. Overall, the deck is designed to outvalue and outlast the opponent in a long game.

This deck focuses on using aggressive creatures with high black mana symbols in their casting cost to generate devotion to black. By consistently playing creatures and spells that require black mana, the deck aims to maximize the effects of cards like Gray Merchant of Asphodel and Desecration Demon. This devotion to black not only powers up certain cards but also allows for the use of cards like Gray Merchant of Asphodel to drain the opponent's life total quickly. The deck also includes disruption and removal spells to control the game and protect its threats.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly establish a board presence and apply pressure to the opponent using aggressive creatures such as Cloudfin Raptor, Frostburn Weird, Judge's Familiar, and Nightveil Specter. The deck also utilizes powerful enchantments like Thassa, God of the Sea and Ephara, God of the Polis to provide additional benefits and control the board. With a mix of disruptive spells like Tidebinder Mage and Detention Sphere, the deck aims to maintain aggression while disrupting the opponent's strategy, ultimately overwhelming them with efficient and strategic plays.

This deck focuses on quickly building up a board presence and putting pressure on the opponent by playing aggressive creatures with high devotion to black. It also includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to keep the opponent on the back foot with cards like Desecration Demon and Pack Rat while draining their life total with Gray Merchant of Asphodel. The mana base is primarily swamps with utility lands like Temple of Deceit and Mutavault to support the aggressive strategy.

The deck focuses on using low-cost creatures and powerful enchantments to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a variety of threats. By repeatedly applying pressure with creatures like Cloudfin Raptor, Nightveil Specter, and Master of Waves, the deck aims to control the board and finish the game swiftly. Thassa, God of the Sea provides additional card draw and unblockable damage, while Tidebinder Mage and Frostburn Weird offer utility and disruption against opposing strategies. With the support of Mutavault and Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx, the deck can consistently apply pressure and secure victories through a combination of aggression and flexibility.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures, using the synergy between creatures like Nightveil Specter, Frostburn Weird, and Master of Waves. Utilizing powerful enchantments like Thassa, God of the Sea and Detention Sphere to control the board and maintain pressure. The inclusion of Mutavault provides additional versatility and ways to push damage through. The deck aims to maintain tempo and take advantage of the opponent's weaknesses, ultimately overwhelming them with efficient creatures and powerful spells.

The main focus of this deck is to aggressively control the board with low-mana cost creatures and disrupt opponents with interaction spells. By leveraging the power of Thassa, God of the Sea and her ability to make creatures unblockable, along with cards like Tidebinder Mage and Frostburn Weird to slow down opponents, this deck aims to quickly overwhelm and outpace the opponent. With a mix of creature aggression and disruptive spells, the Mono Blue Aggro deck seeks to maintain board control and pressure the opponent into submission.
